instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 dont turn on
threads.message:
hello.

the board is not turning on, no liquid to see.

i found a short to GND on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, I pulled the F7140/41, short to gnd still on buckconverter side

i pulled the <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, still the same, so i pulled <TRANSISTOR>Q7135</TRANSISTOR> and no short anymore. I ordered new <TRANSISTOR>Q7135</TRANSISTOR> and after solder in no short anymore, i put bacj the fuses but the board dont turn on

Now i see i forgot to put back the <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, its still pulled out but the short is back, after pulling again the <TRANSISTOR>Q7135</TRANSISTOR> no short anymore

the pulled out new <TRANSISTOR>Q7135</TRANSISTOR> is shorted completly


so i need some help what can damage the <TRANSISTOR>Q7135</TRANSISTOR>? the <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> is still pulled out.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 dont turn on
threads.message:
Yeah, you left high-side MOSFET <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> with Gate floating on air.
Don't do this ever again!!!

However, I suppose it was shorted before; but you only check for short to ground, on <TRANSISTOR>Q7135</TRANSISTOR>.
Be sure to solder ALL removed components and check for shorts BEFORE powering up the board...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 dont turn on
threads.message: Replace <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7135</TRANSISTOR>, and <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> all at the same time ONLY if removing them relieves your short.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 dont turn on
threads.message:
ok, thank you all for your help.

I put the <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> back and the fuses in place, put in another <TRANSISTOR>Q7135</TRANSISTOR> and its working fine everything.

Are you suggest to replace now the <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> as well ? is it needfull?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 dont turn on
threads.message: If it works now, then no. But for future reference, you want to replace all at once.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 dont turn on
threads.message: ok, thanks a lot for your help
